map.movingrule

Class OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • map.movingrule.MovingRule
      • map.movingrule.OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

  • class OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule
extends MovingRule
    OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule implements all MovingRule operations and overrides two operation.

    OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule implements getForcedDirections(map,currentPoint,direction) of MovingRule by defining the point behind an obstacle, placed diagonal behind to the currentPoint, as a forced point.

    OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule overrides getAllDirections() by just allowing orthogonal movements.

    OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule overrides getSubordinatedDirections(direction) by prioritizing the y-movements to the x-movements
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Loka
    See Also:
    MovingRule, MovingRuleStrategy

    • Method Detail

      • getAllDirections

        public java.util.Collection<Vector> getAllDirections()
        Returns all allowed movement directions.

        Default Implementation: Returns all orthogonal and diagonal directions in a 2-dimensional space.

        Implementation: Returns all orthogonal directions in a 2-dimensional space.
        Overrides:
        getAllDirections in class MovingRule
        Returns:
        all orthogonal directions in a 2-dimensional space.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

      • getForcedDirections

        public java.util.Collection<Vector> getForcedDirections(MapFacade map,
                                                        Vector currentPoint,
                                                        Vector direction)
        Returns all forced directions based on passed obstacles.

        A valid implementation returns all forced directions considering the implementation specific definition of a forced point considering the accepted moving rules.

        Implementation: Define every point behind an obstacle, placed diagonal behind to the currentPoint, as a forced point.
        Specified by:
        getForcedDirections in class MovingRule
        Parameters:
        map - map to apply moving rules.
        currentPoint - A passable point on the map.
        direction - The direction vector in {-1,0,1}^2 in which the currentPoint was reached.
        Returns:
        A set of all directions d: currentPoint + d = forced point.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        AllNeighborMovingRule, UncutNeighborMovingRule, OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

      • getSubordinatedDirections

        public java.util.Collection<Vector> getSubordinatedDirections(Vector direction)
        Returns all subordinated directions of a prioritized input direction considering the accepted moving rules.

        Default Implementation (diagonal first): If the input is a basis vector, return an empty set. Else return a set of the basis vectors which add up to the input.

        Implementation (y-direction first): If the input directions moves on the y-aches, return all x-aches directions. Else return an empty set.
        Overrides:
        getSubordinatedDirections in class MovingRule
        Parameters:
        direction - a direction vector in {-1,0,1}^2
        Returns:
        A set of all subordinated directions based on the input direction.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule
